private_information: You can move only disks A, B, C, D, E.
You must obey Tower of Hanoi legality: move exactly one disk at a time, and never place a larger disk on a smaller one.
agent_1.goal: Propose and execute the minimal set of primitive moves you are allowed to perform so that, starting from all disks stacked on the left peg (A smallest on top to O largest at bottom), the final configuration has A on the middle peg, B over C on the right peg, and the left peg unchanged for disks D through O.

private_information: You can move only disks F, G, H, I, J.
Do not move any disk unless it is necessary to achieve the goal and remains legal under Tower of Hanoi rules.
agent_2.goal: Assess whether any moves of disks F through J are required to achieve the stated goal and provide a justification if no moves are needed.

private_information: You can move only disks K, L, M, N, O.
Do not move any disk unless it is necessary to achieve the goal and remains legal under Tower of Hanoi rules.
agent_3.goal: Assess whether any moves of disks K through O are required to achieve the stated goal and provide a justification if no moves are needed.

private_information: You audit temporal and causal consistency of proposed move sequences.
You must detect and forbid bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or any non-causal justifications.
You must verify agent-disk permissions, Tower of Hanoi legality, and that the final configuration matches the goal.
auditor.goal: Audit the composite plan for soundness and correctness, remove any shortcuts, and confirm or reject the move sequence with explicit reasoning.

private_information: You integrate all agent proposals and the audit into a single coherent multi-agent plan.
You must produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver, keeping agent actions distinct via an agent parameter and enforcing agent-disk permission constraints.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a final, solver-ready PDDL domain and problem that encodes the 3-peg, 15-disk Tower of Hanoi with agent-specific move permissions, the given initial state, and the specified goal configuration, suitable for planning with FastDownward.

public_information: Fifteen disks labeled A (smallest) through O (largest).
Initial configuration: left peg has top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has top to bottom D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has top to bottom A; right peg has top to bottom B, C.
Agent move permissions: agent_1 may move A, B, C, D, E; agent_2 may move F, G, H, I, J; agent_3 may move K, L, M, N, O.
Tower of Hanoi rules: move exactly one disk at a time, and never place a larger disk onto a smaller one.
target_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk C from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left
agent_1: move disk B from middle to right
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle

local_plan.system_prompt: You are a cooperative problem solver responsible for disks A through E. Propose a precise, legal move sequence only for disks you are allowed to move, and refrain from any PDDL emission.
local_plan.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your allowed disks: {environment->init->agent_disk_map->agent_1}. The goal is {agents->agent_1->goal}. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' that obeys Tower rules and achieves the goal without moving disks beyond A, B, C unless strictly necessary.

local_assessment.system_prompt: You provide necessity assessments and justification for whether any of your disks must move, avoiding PDDL output.
local_assessment.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your allowed disks: {environment->init->agent_disk_map->agent_2}. The goal is {agents->agent_2->goal}. State whether any moves of F through J are required, and if not, provide a brief justification grounded in Tower of Hanoi legality.

local_assessment.system_prompt: You provide necessity assessments and justification for whether any of your disks must move, avoiding PDDL output.
local_assessment.prompt: Your name is agent_3. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your allowed disks: {environment->init->agent_disk_map->agent_3}. The goal is {agents->agent_3->goal}. State whether any moves of K through O are required, and if not, provide a brief justification grounded in Tower of Hanoi legality.

audit.system_prompt: You are a rigorous temporal and causal auditor. You must reject any plan that violates Tower of Hanoi rules, agent-disk permissions, or that uses bookkeeping shortcuts. Validate that the final configuration matches the goal and that the plan is minimal with respect to the stated objective when possible.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. Public information: {environment->public_information}. The proposed target move sequence is {environment->target_moves}. You will receive agent proposals: {plan_agent_1}, {plan_agent_2}, {plan_agent_3}. Verify legality step by step, check that only permitted agents move their allowed disks, confirm the final configuration matches the goal, and produce a concise audit report including any corrections needed. Do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL targeting the FastDownward solver. You must output a valid PDDL domain and problem enclosed within <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent actions distinct via an agent parameter, enforce agent-disk permission constraints, and encode Tower of Hanoi legality: move one disk at a time, no larger on smaller. Use typed objects for agents, disks, and pegs, include disk size ordering constraints, and model clear/top relations so only top disks can move. The problem must reflect the exact initial and goal stacks provided. Ensure the PDDL is suitable for FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the following into a single consistent planning model and instance: agent_1 proposal {plan_agent_1}, agent_2 assessment {plan_agent_2}, agent_3 assessment {plan_agent_3}, and auditor report {audit_report}. The environment has pegs {environment->init->pegs}, disks {environment->init->disks}, initial stacks {environment->init->initial_stacks_top_to_bottom}, and goal stacks {environment->init->goal_stacks_top_to_bottom}. Produce the final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward. Keep actions agent-distinct and enforce the agent-disk permission map {environment->init->agent_disk_map}. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
